line_1: And still the Graces build my Parian piles:
line_2: Green as of old, each oliv'd portal smiles,

line_1: NYMPHS! YOUR thin forms pervade his glittering piles,
line_2: His roofs of chrystal, and his glassy ailes;

line_1: Rocks rear'd on rocks in huge disjointed piles
line_2: Form the tall turrets, and the lengthen'd ailes;

line_1: Permit me, ye time-hallow'd domes, ye piles
line_2: Amid your fretted vaults and length'ning isles,

line_1: I envy not Augusta's pompous Piles,
line_2: Since rural Solitude more pleasing smiles.
